Which led me to the question if that are organic real listeners or programmed bots? I am not sure. But however, my songs were listened to more during that time.

review_title: SNEAKY : WORST Experience I've ever had with…
review_content: The worst experience I've ever had with this company ! Very Sneaky company ! I would advise you not to go with them.First I ran a Spotify algorithmic campaign with them for 250€ for a month !! And it all went well. I told them I was willing to spend only 250€ and it was only a month and I got confirmation from them in writing ! Then at the end of the 30 days the streams started going down. And I knew it was the end of the campaign. 2 months down the line, I can see that they are still charging my card a sum of 250€ ! And this has been done twice already. So now, I'm down 750€ !! And they will not refund the 500€ extra that they charged my account !! I tried reasoning with them but they are adamant that there was a subscription and I did not cancel the subscription !! But they didn't run any Spotify ads after the first 30 days anyway !! SO WHY ARE THEY RIPPING PEOPLE OFF especially STRUGGLING ARTISTS !! Finally I say, they are SNEAKY and don't do business with them. Take it elsewhere !7th SEPT UPDATE : RESPONSE TO THE REPLY THEY SENT BELOW !I've contacted TMMA Customer Support but seems like they are not willing to listen. Still very adamant and not looking at all the proof (in past correspondence) that I've submitted to them. Moreover, the person from CUSTOMER SERVICE has no idea what is expected off the campaign ! And also how only ALGORITHMIC STREAMS (Radio, Discover Weekly, Daily Mix, Release Radar) which is about 40% of the TOTAL STREAMS received needs to be taken into account. How can I deal with someone who lies, doesn't want to know the history of the issue and past conversations, and most of all, keeps badgering me !! I'm done giving them my precious time ! I've sent them all they require to prove my case but they are not budging ! Just to clarify a few things ! The July 2023 campaign and the only campaign I authorised, started on 4th July and on 11th July I found that the campaign was not doing as they promised. So I contacted them. They apologised and RESTARTED the campaign on 11th July and said they will START from 0 !! (You can confirm the above in the linked screenshots !)I have all the screenshots of the correspondence between them. Here they are :https: // rb.gy /48ur1(Delete SPACES in the link above and open in your browser)So the only campaign I authorised payment for ran from 4th July (restarted on 11th July) to 11th August ! Unlike what they said below in their reply that TMMA ran a second campaign from 4th to 11th August. That's just rubbish and very sneaky to take my money like this So in the end, they just ran the only campaign (till 11th August) and kept charging me (twice) for two months in succession ! Also only the streams generated from ALGORITHMIC plays (Radio, Discover Weekly, Daily Mix, Release Radar) are counted towards this campaign. So it's about 40% of the plays that they said it would be. It's all in BLACK and WHITE ! They offered to pay me back but in coupons/vouchers ! But I WANT MY MONEY BACK IN MY ACCOUNT ! Money that I DID NOT AUTHORIZE WAS TAKEN FROM MY ACCOUNT. You see it clearly states in our correspondence that it is for a "SINGLE" 30 day campaign ! That's THEFT and I WANT MY MONEY BACK !

Im still sceptical, as everyone ought to be.

I recently used Top Music Marketing Agency's playlisting services and it was not at all what I expected. The agency claims that their playlists have authentic listeners, but after conducting a full analysis on the playlists my song was added to, it became clear that they are loaded with fake streams and listeners.Fake streams and listeners can be harmful to an artist's career, as they can damage your chances of reaching your target audience and even lead to a violation of Spotify's terms and conditions. I reached out to Spotify to share my concerns about Top Music Marketing Agency's services and provided them with playlist analytics, which confirmed that the playlists did include "bot" listeners.It's disappointing that Top Music Marketing Agency markets their services with claims of authenticity when in reality, they use fake listeners to boost stream and listener counts. If you're simply looking for a temporary increase in numbers, then their services might work for you. But if you're looking to build an actual audience and find real fans, I strongly suggest looking elsewhere.As an artist, it's important to prioritize authenticity and genuine engagement with your listeners. Using Top Music Marketing Agency's playlisting services can harm your reputation and credibility in the music industry. If you want to establish yourself and build a genuine following, it's best to avoid agencies that use fake listeners and instead search for services that prioritize authenticity and genuine engagement.Update to TMMA’s Reply: Thank you for your reply. While I appreciate your efforts to convince me that your services are authentic, I have extensive experience in analyzing analytics and can easily spot a fraudulent marketing agency. I placed a second order for a different song before receiving any results. I unfortunately was too eager to put my trust in your company, therefore your assumption is false, I was not satisfied with your services.When I provided multiple screenshots of the playlist analytics, you gave me an excuse about Spotify's password resets causing spike drops and rises in listeners. However, this explanation makes no sense as Spotify has not announced any massive password reset event. When I asked for proof of authenticity, you were unable to provide it and instead gave another excuse. Your claim that the playlist creators advertise on Instagram is not evidence of authenticity, as it does not prove organic growth.In contrast, an agent from Spotify confirmed that those playlists were filled with fake listeners and that they would be looking into taking them down. Spotify also warns against trusting online services that promise playlist placements, streams, or listeners.While you claim to have reviews from publishers like Forbes and Billboard, those articles do not mention Top Music Marketing Agency at all. This is misleading to clients.I urge other artists to not risk their careers on fake streams. It's simply not worth it. Top Music Marketing Agency should market their services honestly instead of tricking users into thinking they will gain real growth2nd Update to TMMA's Reply:No problem I'II happily share your playlists analytics below:Playlist 1: https://ibb .co/kqy6wvvPlaylist 1 Listener Spike: https://ibb .co/mvRHaTOPlaylist 2: https://ibb .co/KrSV2nyPlaylist 2 Listener Spike: https://ibb .co/qyZrYJRThe two different playlists you provided have the exact same insane spike drop on the same day, followed by a huge spike rise in listeners the next day. This is highly suspicious and further proves that your company is simply a scheme into buying fake streams and listeners.It's also worth noting that it's contradictory for you to claim that your playlists provide organic growth, while also telling me personally that playlists are not the real way to grow my profile. I have attached a screenshot of this conversation for reference:https://ibb. co/VxN1WOm

I came across the advert on Instagram and tried it out. They are simply the best genuine marketing agency out there. From 3 monthly listeners to over 680 monthly listeners within a few days. I’m impressed. Wish I can score them a million stars.

At first all was going well. We hired TMMA for all different types of their promotional services.Unfortunately coming up to almost a year now (2024) with a rolling monthly subscription for playlisting, our artists music was flagged by Spotify and removed owing to bots being used.TMMA admitted responsibility for their mistake and offered only one months subscription fee as a refund as resolve of the issue. They pointed out their refund policy.In this instance TMMA should have done the correct thing and refunded all of our money as a settlement for their gross misconduct, this also caused our artist extreme stress and anxiety and defamation of brand image owing to his A-list collaborators.We are currently pursuing legal action against this fraudulent company for all costs and damages.I strongly advise anybody who wishes to enlist TMMA to cross check all policies with the streaming platforms used and the services TMMA offer to avoid your music becoming blacklisted.We had to change our distributor to try and save our artists profile on Spotify, but for how long we do not know as the songs are now in this crooked algorithm.

They do what they promise, they put into practice what they say. It’s not something obvious nowadays. One of the most serious agencies among the thousands that pop up like mushrooms just to make money!

My song got placed on several playlists that looked suspicious. I then queried TMMA about it which they denied. I requested my songs to be removed and a refund. Then baiscally got ignored saying that my song was placed in 10 additional playlists for my "unsatisfaction". (Which they didn't do either and only sent links to 2 playlists)Here's the interesting part, after investigating the additional playlists for the last 28 days, their playlist followers would drop with +/-1000 - 3000 followers in 1 day, some songs have been on the playlist for longer than a year and new songs that aren't relevant to the playlist genre are mixed in between. Also looking into these curators Spotify profiles their playlist has thousands of followers, but their own profile has hardly any followers and they aren't following artists either. So it indicates probable fake profiles with botted listeners/followers.So in essense this company doesn't deliver on their promises and do not honor their refund policy. Rather treat yourself to a good meal and Starbucks. Will be money better spent!
